item.title: Depression, tiredness, stress have led to less sex...
item.description:
extra.ie
Depression, tiredness and stress have led to fewer people having sex, a new survey has found. Around 12% of those surveyed by sexual wellness brand LELO have not had an intimate experience in over three years. The Sex Census put together by LELO found that although the pandemic has obviously hindered some people's sex lives, other factors have also come into play. However, 76.5% of people in couples reported not having more sex than usual despite spending lockdown with their partner back in April 2020. The most common factor that has stopped people from having sex is tiredness with 35.7%
